title: 25 Greatest Speeches Of Vivekananda: Collectable  A Classic Collection Of Great Speeches | Spiritual | Enlightenment
author: Swami Vivekananda
description: This collection compiles 25 of Vivekananda's most inspiring and influential speeches, offering timeless wisdom on spirituality, self-discovery, and the pursuit of a meaningful life.  These speeches, delivered across various platforms, delve into themes of Vedanta philosophy, social reform, and the power of the human spirit, making them relevant for readers seeking guidance and enlightenment.

title: Dopamine Detox : A Short Guide to Remove Distractions and Get Your Brain to Do Hard Things
author: Thibaut Meurisse
description: Dopamine Detox is a concise and practical guide to understanding the impact of dopamine on our daily lives and how it can lead to procrastination and distraction. This book provides a clear framework for recognizing dopamine triggers, developing strategies for managing them, and cultivating focus and productivity. Learn to break free from addictive behaviors and reclaim your time and energy, enabling you to tackle challenging tasks and achieve your goals with increased motivation and self-discipline.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd named Santiago travels from his homeland in Andalusia to the Egyptian desert in search of treasure buried near the Pyramids. Along the way, he meets a cast of unforgettable characters who teach him about the world and himself, including an old king, a thief, and an alchemist.

title: Colouring Book Set for Kids  | Gift to Preschool Children for Painting and Drawing | Crayon & Copy Coloring Activity Books for 2+ Year Olds
author: 10% off coupon appliedSave 10%  with coupon
description: This colourful and engaging colouring book set is the perfect gift for preschool children aged 2+ years old. Featuring a variety of fun and easy-to-colour images, this book will help your child develop their fine motor skills, creativity, and imagination. With plenty of space to colour, your child will be entertained for hours. The book also includes a variety of different colouring techniques, making it fun and educational for young children.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry Potter is an ordinary boy - until he discovers on his eleventh birthday that he is a wizard and has been accepted into Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.  He is swept away into a world of magic and wonder, where he discovers his own true powers as he befriends Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, and finds out about the evil Lord Voldemort who killed his parents, who is planning to steal the Philosopher's Stone for his own dark purposes.

title: The Girl Who Drank the Moon
author: Kelly Barnhill
description: A young girl, abandoned as a baby in the woods, is raised by a witch. As she grows older, she discovers that she has magical powers and a destiny that will change the fate of her world.

title: Greatest Short Stories of Dostoevsky
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: This collection presents some of Dostoevsky's most profound and thought-provoking short stories, exploring themes of crime, morality, human nature, and the search for meaning.

title: The Theory Of Everything
author: Stephen Hawking
description: The Theory of Everything explores the fundamental laws governing the universe, from the smallest subatomic particles to the vast expanse of galaxies. It delves into concepts like quantum mechanics, general relativity, and the nature of time, space, and matter. The book offers a comprehensive overview of modern physics, making complex theories accessible to a wider audience.

title: Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A young woman named Elara finds herself inexplicably transformed into a dragon, plunging her into a world of magic, adventure, and self-discovery. As she navigates the challenges of her new form, she must uncover the secrets behind her metamorphosis and embrace her destiny as a powerful guardian of her ancient lineage.

title: The Richest Man In Babylon by George S. Clason
author: George S. Clason
description: This timeless classic offers practical financial advice through parables set in ancient Babylon.  Discover the secrets to wealth creation and management, emphasizing the importance of saving, investing, and living below your means.

title: The Diary of A Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The Diary of A Young Girl is a profound and intimate account of a young girl's life during World War II. Through her diary entries, Anne Frank shares her thoughts, dreams, and fears as she and her family hide from the Nazis. This book offers invaluable insights into resilience, hope, and the human spirit in the face of adversity.

title: 50 World’s Greatest Horror Stories: Collectable
author: Various
description: A chilling anthology of 50 of the world's most terrifying tales, each meticulously curated for its ability to evoke shivers and nightmares. From haunted castles to otherworldly creatures, this collection will leave you questioning what lies beyond the veil of reality. Prepare to delve into a world of darkness, where shadows whisper secrets and fear takes hold.

title: World’s Greatest Classic
author: Jane Austen F. Scott Fitzgerald, Oscar Wilde, Emily Brontë
description: In a world where magic is real, a young apprentice discovers a hidden truth about his lineage and embarks on a perilous journey to fulfill his destiny. Join him as he faces mythical creatures, unravel ancient mysteries, and learns the true meaning of courage and sacrifice.

title: The Power of Your Subconscious Mind
author: Joseph Murphy
description: This book explores the vast potential of your subconscious mind and how harnessing its power can lead to profound personal growth, improved mental health, and a more fulfilling life.  Discover techniques to reprogram limiting beliefs, overcome negative patterns, and achieve your full potential through the power of your subconscious mind.

title: The 1,000-Year-Old Boy
author: Ross Welford
description: A timeless tale of a 1,000-year-old boy who finds himself thrust into the modern world, grappling with the wonders and absurdities of technology, love, and the passage of time.  This whimsical adventure explores the enduring spirit of youth, the complexities of aging, and the importance of living life to the fullest, no matter how long or short it may be.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: "The Psychology of Money" delves into the intricate relationship between our emotions and financial decision-making. Through insightful analysis and practical advice, the book explores common psychological biases that influence our spending, saving, and investing habits.  It provides a framework for understanding the irrationalities of human behavior in the financial realm, empowering readers to make more informed and rational choices with their money.

title: Ikigai: Japanese secret to long and happy life
author: Francesc Miralles
description: "Ikigai: Japanese secret to long and happy life" explores the concept of ikigai, a Japanese philosophy that emphasizes finding purpose and meaning in life. It delves into the principles of living a fulfilling and joyful life, drawing inspiration from the wisdom of Okinawan centenarians. This book provides practical strategies and insights to help readers discover their own ikigai, fostering a sense of well-being and longevity.

The books are filled with simple and colorful pictures that are perfect for little hands to practice their drawing and coloring skills. With a variety of themes to choose from, these books are sure to keep your child entertained for hours.
